data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Love looks not with the eyes, but with the mind, And therefore is winged Cupid painted blind.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: A fool thinks himself to be wise, but a wise man knows himself to be a fool.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: No legacy is so rich as honesty.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: This above all; to thine own self be true.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Better three hours too soon than a minute too late.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: It is a wise father that knows his own child.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: I say there is no darkness but ignorance.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Our peace shall stand as firm as rocky mountains.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: The empty vessel makes the loudest sound.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: My crown is called content, a crown that seldom kings enjoy.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Let every eye negotiate for itself and trust no agent.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Pleasure and action make the hours seem short.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Better a witty fool than a foolish wit.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Suspicion always haunts the guilty mind.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: The very substance of the ambitious is merely the shadow of a dream.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: I must be cruel, only to be kind.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: To be, or not to be, that is the question.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Nothing can come of nothing.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.

data.author: William Shakespeare
data.quote: Boldness be my friend.
